Key Match Events: Wirtz (1') scored the first goal of the match
Havertz (49') scored a goal for Germany
Nagelsmann (60') made a tactical change by bringing in Fulle (Niclas Fullkrug) behind Havertz
Andrich (68') made a tactical change by bringing in Maximilian Mittelstadt at left-back
Pre-Game Insights: Julian Nagelsmann confirmed that Kai Havertz will start as a striker in Saturday's friendly against France
Nagelsmann believes that Havertz has 'developed very well' under Gunners boss Mikel Arteta this season
Nagelsmann thinks highly of Havertz as a player and as a person
Nagelsmann said that Havertz has good deep runs and very good pace
Nagelsmann mentioned that Fulle (Niclas Fullkrug) brings a different profile and Deniz (Undav) can also play in other positions
Post-Match Reflections: Germany endeavored to end a three-man winless streak
Germany took on a France side whom they beat 2-1 in a home friendly in September last year
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany's Manuel Neuer sustained a muscle tear in his left thigh during training earlier this week and will be out for ten days
Nagelsmann confirmed that Neuer will be his number-one shot-stopper for Euro 2024
Others: The match was played at Parc Olympique Lyonnais in France
The match was a friendly match as part of the Euro 2024 preparations
